examples.sentence: 〜にちがいない - Must be (strong conviction)

sections.heading: Understanding はずだ
sections.content:
〜はずだ expresses logical expectations based on facts, plans, or reasoning (85-95% certainty). It indicates what should logically be true or happen, not personal conviction but objective reasoning.

彼は3時に来るはずだ (scheduled, that's the plan) "He should come at 3" これで動くはずだ (logically should work) "This should work" 彼は知っているはずだ (it's reasonable he knows) "He should know"

children.heading: Where はずだ fits
children.content: 30-50%: かもしれない (might) 60-80%: だろう (probably) 85-95%: はずだ (should/expected) ← Based on facts 90-99%: にちがいない (must be) ← Based on conviction はずだ = logical expectation にちがいない = personal conviction

children.heading: Plain form + はずだ
children.content: Verbs: 来る → 来るはずだ 来た → 来たはずだ 来ない → 来ないはずだ い-adjectives: 高い → 高いはずだ 高くない → 高くないはずだ な-adjectives: 便利 → 便利なはずだ (Use な before はずだ) Nouns: 学生 → 学生のはずだ (Use の before はずだ)

children.heading: Based on plans/schedules
children.content: 会議は10時に始まるはずです "The meeting should start at 10" Based on: Official schedule Not personal opinion

children.heading: Based on prior information
children.content: 彼は医者のはずだ "He should be a doctor" Based on: What you were told Not speculation

children.heading: Based on logic/common sense
children.content: 勉強したから、できるはずだ "I studied, so I should be able to do it" Based on: Cause and effect logic Reasonable expectation

children.heading: Based on rules/procedures
children.content: この手順で正しいはずです "This procedure should be correct" Based on: Established rules Standard practice

sections.heading: はずだ vs にちがいない

children.heading: はずだ - Objective expectation
children.content: 彼は来るはずだ "He should come" (the plan says so) Based on: - Facts - Plans - Logic - Information Objective basis

children.heading: にちがいない - Personal conviction
children.content: 彼は来るにちがいない "He must come" (I'm very sure) Based on: - Strong belief - Evidence - Intuition Personal certainty

children.heading: Example comparison
children.content: Situation: Train schedule says train comes at 3pm はずだ: 電車は3時に来るはずだ "The train should come at 3" (according to schedule) にちがいない: 電車は3時に来るにちがいない "The train must come at 3" (I'm personally certain) はずだ is more neutral, factual

children.heading: Strong denial based on logic
children.content: 彼が嘘をつくはずがない "There's no way he would lie" (it's not logical) そんな簡単なはずがない "It can't be that easy" (logically shouldn't be) Based on what's reasonable Logical impossibility

children.heading: Unfulfilled expectations
children.content: 彼は来るはずだった "He was supposed to come" (but didn't) 簡単なはずだったのに "It was supposed to be easy, but..." Shows disappointment Reality differed from expectation

children.heading: はずだ (plain)
children.content: 来るはずだ "Should come"

children.heading: はずです (polite)
children.content: 来るはずです "Should come" Standard polite

children.heading: はずでございます (very polite)
children.content: そのはずでございます "That should be so" Formal, humble

children.heading: ～はずなのに (Should...but)
children.content: できるはずなのに、できない "I should be able to do it, but I can't" 簡単なはずなのに、難しい "It should be easy, but it's difficult" Reality contradicts expectation

children.heading: ～はずがない (Can't be)
children.content: 忘れるはずがない "There's no way I'd forget" 間違っているはずがない "It can't be wrong" Logical impossibility

children.heading: ～はずだ (Verification)
children.content: これで正しいはずです "This should be correct" そのはずだよ "That should be so" Confirming expectations

children.heading: ～ないはずだ (Shouldn't)
children.content: 彼は来ないはずだ "He shouldn't come" (not in the plan) 高くないはずです "It shouldn't be expensive" (based on info) Negative logical expectation

children.heading: Should have done
children.content: 彼は昨日来たはずだ "He should have come yesterday" ここにあったはずなのに "It should have been here" Past logical expectation

children.heading: Seeking confirmation
children.content: そうですよね？そのはずですよね？ "Right? That should be so, right?" 彼は知っているはずですが "He should know, but..." Checking expectations

children.heading: Checking your memory
children.content: ここに置いたはずなんだけど... "I should have put it here..." 言ったはずだけどな "I should have told you..." Questioning memory

children.heading: When reality doesn't match
children.content: 動くはずなのに、動かない "It should work, but it doesn't" 簡単なはずなのに、分からない "It should be easy, but I don't understand" Puzzlement

children.heading: As a noun
children.content: そのはずだ "That should be the case" そのはずです "That's what's expected" そのはずはない "That can't be right" Nominalized form

children.heading: In documentation
children.content: この方法で問題は解決されるはずである "This method should solve the problem" 結果は来週発表されるはずです "Results should be announced next week" Professional contexts

children.heading: Schedules and appointments
children.content: 会議は2時に始まるはずです "The meeting should start at 2" 彼は今日休むはずだ "He should be off today" Based on schedule

children.heading: Abilities and knowledge
children.content: 彼は医者だから、知っているはずだ "He's a doctor, so he should know" 勉強したから、できるはずです "I studied, so I should be able to do it" Logical expectation from facts

children.heading: Location and existence
children.content: ここにあるはずなんだけど "It should be here" 図書館にいるはずです "He should be at the library" Based on information

children.heading: はずだ - Based on facts
children.content: 時刻表によると、電車は3時に来るはずだ "According to the timetable, the train should come at 3" Objective basis

children.heading: だろう - Estimation
children.content: たぶん3時頃に来るだろう "It'll probably come around 3" Subjective guess

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 彼は今日来るはずです "He should come today" これで動くはずだ "This should work" 知っているはずです "You should know"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 説明書を読んだから、できるはずです。 でも、なぜかうまくいかない "I read the manual, so I should be able to do it. But for some reason it's not going well" 彼は今ごろ家に着いたはずだ。 連絡がないのが心配だ "He should have arrived home by now. I'm worried there's no contact" ここに鍵を置いたはずなのに、 どこにも見当たらない "I should have put the key here, but I can't find it anywhere"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 計算が正しければ、この答えで 合っているはずだ。しかし、何か 違和感がある。もう一度確認してみよう。 念のため、別の方法でも計算するべきだ。 "If the calculation is correct, this answer should be right. However, something feels off. Let's check again. Just to be safe, we should calculate using a different method too." 彼の性格を考えれば、約束を破るはずがない。 何か問題があったにちがいない。事故に 遭ったのではないかと心配だ。すぐに 連絡を取ったほうがいいだろう。 "Considering his character, there's no way he'd break a promise. There must have been some problem. I'm worried he might have had an accident. We should probably contact him right away."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜にちがいない - Must be (strong conviction) 〜だろう - Probably (estimation) 〜はずがない - Can't be (logical impossibility) 〜はずだった - Was supposed to 〜かもしれない - Might be Logical expectations - Expressing should
